column4: OK, everyone, I'm a new Ubuntu user who made the mistake of attempting to install the operating system to a USB key from another USB key. Now I'm stuck having to use a GNOME-based multi-boot menu every time I want to run Windows 7. I'd like to remove the GNOME-based multi-boot menu so that I can at least re-install Ubuntu on a seperate computer where I can mess around with it without running...
OK, so what commands do i need to input to reinstall grub?
for future reference, if you want a true USB key install the one thing you MUST do during the install is select to install Grub onto the USB device, and NOT the default of the hard disk
